title: Structure and Properties of N2 and N2H4

content.question:
For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

Answer the following questions about <math alttext="N 2"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N 2 H 4"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) In the box below, draw the complete Lewis electron-dot diagram of <math alttext="N 2"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> .

frqParts.text:
For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate.

Answer the following questions about <math alttext="N 2"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N 2 H 4"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) In the box below, draw the complete Lewis electron-dot diagram of <math alttext="N 2"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> .

(b) Based on the Lewis electron-dot diagram that you drew, is the <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule polar? Explain.

The following graph shows the potential energy of two nitrogen atoms versus the distance between their nuclei.

(c) On the graph, indicate the distance that corresponds to the bond length of the <math alttext="N 2"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecule by placing an <math alttext="X"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the horizontal axis.

(d) On the graph, which shows the potential energy curve of two <math alttext="N"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms, carefully sketch a curve that corresponds to the potential energy of two <math alttext="O"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms versus the distance between their nuclei.

<math alttext="N 2"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> can react with <math alttext="H 2"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> to form the compound <math alttext="N 2 H 4"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>.
(e) A sample of <math alttext="N 2 H 4"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> has a mass of <math alttext="25 grams"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Identify the numerical quantity that is needed to convert the number of grams of <math alttext="N 2 H 4"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to the number of moles of <math alttext="N 2 H 4"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. (You do not need to do the actual calculation.)

(f) The Lewis electron-dot diagram of <math alttext="N 2 H 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown below.

(i) Based on the Lewis electron-dot diagrams of <math alttext="N 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N 2 H 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, compare the length of the nitrogen-to-nitrogen bond in <math alttext="N 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> with the length of the nitrogen-to-nitrogen bond in <math alttext="N 2 H 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(ii) Based on the Lewis electron-dot diagrams of <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and <math alttext="N 2 H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>, compare the strength of the nitrogen-to-nitrogen bond in <math alttext="N 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> with the strength of the nitrogen-to-nitrogen bond in <math alttext="N 2 H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>.

(iii) Identify the hybridization of the <math alttext="N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms in <math alttext="N 2 H 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>.

skill.text: 3.A: Represent chemical phenomena using appropriate graphing techniques, including correct scale and units.
